column4: how to install file:///home/mariuspurcaru/Desktop/firefox-1.5.0.5.tar.gz on my computer without adept or other repository thing ...

nothing is not a useful error meassage :)
just typing  cd  <enter> will always take you back to /home/yourusernme
when I'm typing cd ... and than dir, I get this message: dbootstrap_settings
typing "cd" takes you to your $HOME directory
even when i'm as a sudo?
you can't "be sudo" - are you root? In that case cd takes you to /root
you use sudo - for instance, only the "make install" command requires that
